alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 14 at 8:53PM EST until December 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Watch, minor to moderate coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday night. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...With minor to moderate coastal flooding possible, roads along the Gulf could become flooded quickly and be impassible. Low lying structures immediately along the waterfront could experience flooding and become isolated. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide is around 5 am ET on Sunday morning. While it is too early to specify how high water levels could rise around the time of high tide, water levels could rise quickly during the overnight hours.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
